info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 19 at 12:24PM MDT until October 20 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland KS
info.description:
...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Forecast on Monday...
Strong northwest winds will develop in the wake of a cold frontal passage Monday morning. Strong winds will persist through the afternoon, when relative humidity readings are forecast to fall into the mid-teens. Blowing dust may accompany the winds through the day as well.
The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 252 Yuma, 253 Kit Carson and 254 Cheyenne.
* TIMING...From 11 AM to 6 PM MDT Monday.
* WINDS...Northwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent.
* IMPACTS...Unpredictable fire behavior. Any fires that develop may rapidly grow and spread out of control.
info.instruction: Comply with burn bans and regulations. Avoid driving on dry grass or brush. Maintain vehicle brakes and tires and secure tow chains to avoid dragging. Never toss lit cigarettes onto the ground.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MDT MONDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 252, 253, AND 254
